results.title: Frescoes in Danish churches
results.creator_credit: Jorgen Roos, Luciano Emmer, Dansk Kulturfilm and Teknisk Film
results.brief_description: Uses church frescoes to relate a biblical theme. Depicts the creation and fall of man, the devil and death, the last judgement and hell. No dialogue is spoken in this film.

results.brief_description:
French Hortson cinema style 16mm projector. Unusual right-hand commercial projector, as used in European Cinemas. Manufactured in Paris, painted light blue, on cast iron stand. Model A.

results.title: French explorations in the new world
results.brief_description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. Tracing the pattern of exploration through Verrazano, Cartier, Champlain, Marquette, Joliet and La Salle, the film shows how soldier-explorers and missionaries planted the earliest of French settlements and laid the foundations for French strongholds in the New World.
results.description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. results.title: French children: a farm family in Brittany
results.brief_description: Depicts a farm family living in Brittany. Emphasises family life, showing the work of each member and revealing customs and traditions. Includes scenes in a village school, an old castle and a neighbouring farm.

results.title: French-Canadian children

results.title: Fremantle, first port in Australia
results.creator_credit: Les Bambury and Fremantle Port Authority
results.brief_description: Port facilities at Fremantle, Western Australia. The modern administrative buildings; the port inspection ship “Challenger”; two berth passenger terminal; cargo handling; rail and air terminals. Also some highlights of the port’s history.

results.title: Freeze-in
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Albert Kish and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film essay without commentary about the port of Montreal as winter closes in - the last-minute scurry as ships that can make it dash for open water, while those that cannot prepare for a long hold-over. On the docks all activity seems suspended as the numbing cold closes its grip. But there is activity on the iced-in ships and in the freight sheds, making ready for the time when the icebreakers open a river channel and traffic returns. Film without words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F Whitman Trecartin, Albert Kish and ONF | NFB

results.title: Freestyle
results.creator_credit: David Lowe, Matt Morgan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The police investigating the murder of a young male swimmer interview a woman who regularly swims in the pool where he was murdered. Did she really not see anything?
